definition: war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)

sentences.english: After the War of Resistance Against Japan, Tsinghua University was removed from Kunming to Beiping in 1946.
sentences.chinese: 清华大学在抗战胜利后的1946年由昆明迁回北平。

sentences.english: We were bombed out during the Anti-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 抗战期间我们被炸得无家可归。

sentences.english: Zhou Gucheng concerns himself with Chinas modernization from the period of the War of Resistence Against Japan.
sentences.chinese: 从抗战时期起周谷城就关心国家的现代化问题。

sentences.english: This crisis can be overcome only if resistance is carried out jointly by the people and the government.
sentences.chinese: 惟有实行民众和政府一致的抗战，才能挽救这个危局。

sentences.english: Since 1937, he had been teaching in The South-Western United University in Kunming.
sentences.chinese: 1937年抗战开始，他在昆明西南联大任教。

sentences.english: We should acclaim and support the heroic resistance of Feng Chih-an's troops.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该赞扬和拥护冯治安部的英勇抗战。

sentences.english: This temple served for an operating room during the Anti-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 在抗战时期这座庙曾用来作手术室。

sentences.english: Shanghai's culture of Anti-Japanese War was a model in the development of the national culture.
sentences.chinese: 上海抗战文化在全国文化发展中具有典型意义。

sentences.english: The 15-year-old recently passed away following a long fight with cancer.
sentences.chinese: 这15岁的孩子长期与癌症抗战后，于曰前去世。

sentences.english: Therefore, the prospect of going over from partial to total resistance does exist.
sentences.chinese: 因此，从片面抗战转变到全面抗战的前途是存在的。

sentences.english: Therefore, the prospect of going over from partial to total resistance does exist.
sentences.chinese: 因此，从片面抗战转变到全面抗战的前途是存在的。

sentences.english: For a time, the roaring guns of the resistance at Lukouchiao decided the issue.
sentences.chinese: 卢沟桥抗战的炮声，把这个争论暂时地解决了。

sentences.english: The application of the policy of armed resistance and of the above measures depends on this united front.
sentences.chinese: 执行抗战的方针和上述各项政策，依靠这个联合阵线。

sentences.english: After the War of Resistance Against Japan broke out, the thought of quintessence of Chinese traditional music declined rapidly too.
sentences.chinese: 抗战全面爆发后，国粹主义音乐思潮也迅速走向衰落。

sentences.english: In Afghanistan, there have been no countermeasure, and munication technology at all.
sentences.chinese: 正在阿富汗，根柢讲没有上甚么电子对抗战通信足艺。

sentences.english: Ten years before the anti—Japanese war saw the formation of National government's policy on Tibet.
sentences.chinese: 抗战前十年是国民政府对藏政策的形成时期。

definition: to resist Japan (esp. during WW2)/anti-Japanese (esp. wartime activities)
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Chinese Civil War, also known as War of Liberation 解放戰爭|解放战争[Jie3 fang4 Zhan4 zheng1]
New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
Guomindang 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] and Chinese Communist Party 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3]
Marco Polo Bridge Incident of 7th July 1937, regarded as the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War 抗日戰爭|抗日战争[Kang4 Ri4 Zhan4 zheng1]
Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Eighth Route Army, the larger of the two major Chinese communist forces fighting the Japanese in the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)
Resist US, help North Korea (1950s slogan)
Marco Polo Bridge Incident of 7th July 1937, regarded as the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War 抗日戰爭|抗日战争[Kang4 Ri4 Zhan4 zheng1]
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Huaihai Campaign (Nov 1948-Jan 1949), one of the three major campaigns by the People's Liberation Army near the end of the Chinese Civil War, considered the determining battle of the war
